broken_up_start: ^You're happy to see Bernadette again. She sits down on the massage bed, still as a statue, then turns to face you.

s: ^"Bernadette... I'm so sorry. Are you safe?"
^"How sad... It's a good thing you still came here, despite everything. Please, let me help you."

alright_question: ^"No. Far from it. But I don't want to spoil your day with my moping – which mask is your favorite? Could you do that one today, pretty please?"
safe_question: ^Her gaze falls to the floor. She inhales, sharply, once, twice. "I think so." Then the smile you're so used to blooms on her face. "It's sweet of you to care. We probably won't see each other for a few months – I'll miss you, you know? But oh, I'm bringing up unpleasant things again. Sorry – could we start with the treatment?"
mask_question: ^"Doctor, doctor, doctor. Yes. Please. Help me."
couple_start: ^Bernadette looks more fragile than ever. She's sitting on the very edge of the bed, trying to take up the least space possible.

^"Oh, doctor. There's so much I want to tell you, but I think I shouldn't. You're here to do your job, after all..." She sighs. Her gaze is stuck to the floor. "Please ignore me, if you wish to. I don't want to guilt you into... anything, really. Into listening or talking."
^You are here to do your job, but talking to people like her brightens your day. Especially when you're able to support them.

s: ^"Don't worry, Bernadette, I like talking to you. My parents say I was a talkative child, annoyingly so. And I feel for you. You can tell me anything."
^"Please don't overthink it, Bernadette. I talk to you willingly.  So let's talk: is the current treatment helping you manage your moods? Maybe we should try different ingredients..."

offer_talk: ^"Thank you. It means a lot. Well, we're not in a good spot right now, me and Jake. He loves me, I know he does, but then there are moments when he scares me so much, and I don't know what to –" She claps her hand over her mouth like a child caught swearing. "Sorry. I shouldn't have started talking about it. Could we please continue with the treatment?"

c-0: ^You desperately try to remember if there was anything in the MASK training materials about situations like that. There wasn't. But you should help her, that's what you're here for. So you piece together a few sentences about referring her to the police, if she wants that... It feels hollow. You're not sure if she's listening.

offer_mask: ^"That's... a good idea," she says. Her lips part slightly, she almost starts speaking again, and then thinks better of it.

s: ^Making a mask is a ritual. It requires precision, and precision requires reverence.

c-0: ^You lack it, you stupid, confused thing.
^You can't make a mistake. You can't.

^Life has been so strange lately. All these people, not functioning as intended – and then there's you, the worst of them all. Your mind slips and you wonder, again, if what you're doing can be considered help in the first place.

prep: ^Primer, skin protection, gel. Bernadette's phone rings. You see a name light up, and you see the fear in her eyes, and then her hand flies to the screen by reflex and clicks the answer button.
^"Bernie." The voice coming out of the speaker is cold and calm. A few seconds pass before he continues. "Bernie, baby. You went there, didn't you? You lying on the bed in the middle of the room?"
jake_ex: ^"You paid for the appointment, you booked it. I thought it would be wasteful if I missed it."
^"But you're known for being wasteful, aren't you? You left me, you heartless bitch." He laughs. "I don't mean to be rude. You've hurt me again, that's all."
jake_current: ^"Yes, yes, you paid for the appointment, you booked it, how could I not –"
^"And do you ever do what you're fucking told? You don't, Bernie. That's why we argue all the fucking time."
not_alone: ^"Jake, please, the aesthetician is right here –"
jake_talk_2: ^You notice a drop of gel on her chin. It will fall on her dress if you don't stop it. You take a step forward, reach out towards the drop –
jake_talk_3: ^"I thought about everything we went through, and I thought about your recent behavior, too..."
jake_talk_4: ^Bernadette frowns. Her face seems sharper now, and there's something new in it, something you've never seen before.
^Jake's tone stays almost flat. "Our relationship can still be fixed, baby. Be a good girl, would you?"
get_back_together: ^"We're meant for each other. You don't wanna lose me. I know. And you can have me back, just start with a nice apology instead of treating me like I'm a monster."
^"You shouldn't have called. Leave me. Please, leave me, we're done."
fix_bernadette: ^"You're so... Ugh, you could try being a better partner, maybe? You treat me like I'm a monster. Even now, I'm giving you a chance, I called you. You could've apologized for hiding in your room because you couldn't handle a joke. Too proud to apologize?"
jake_talk_6: ^"What is this kindergarten bullshit? Come on, you're better than that."
^"Jake. There are many things I'm sorry for, but not that. I did nothing wrong there."

c-0: ^It's like he's in the room with you and Bernadette. You can feel your heartbeat in the tips of your fingers.

jake_talk_7: ^"Giving me the silent treatment? No matter. My girlfriend's gone crazy. She's broken, see? Shouldn't you, like, care about her mental state?"

s: ^You need guidance. You failed so much lately.

jake_talk_8: ^"Put the mask on her. Please, God, I'm begging you. She needs it."
^Bernadette is staring at the screen, lips pressed into a tight line. Hatred. That's what you saw in her face. Her hand, the one holding the phone, is trembling slightly.
ask_bernadette: ^You ask her, voice unsure and helpless. Bernie looks away.
^"Aesthetician. Now. She told me about you. She said you care about your clients."

s: ^His tone is disgusting, but he is right.

give_in: ^You lose the next few minutes of your life. It's called dissociation, you remember. The mask covers Bernadette's face. She doesn't struggle, just looks at you, and looks, and looks, and then her eyes sink shut.
fuck_jake: ^"Yes, fuck you! That's what I should've said years ago. Some people actually care about others. And don't you dare talk to me again." She ends the call.
^"Thank you... Jake really wanted you to put the mask on me, didn't he? Not for my benefit, for his..."
^Bernadette stands up. "It made me think... You are a miracle worker, I'm not taking that back, God, you've always eased my pain."
resolution: ^"And I always felt like a doll afterwards. Maybe I was like one? Maybe... shit, maybe it's a bad thing. I really wished it wasn't. Do you use the masks yourself?"

s: ^"I do. I'm not sure if I want to use one again. There is a lot to think about, huh? Absurdly so."
^"I do, and it's none of your business."
